Looking for opportunities!

About Me

Welcome!

I’m Shaun! I’m 23 and I will graduate from University College Dublin, Ireland with a Masters degree in energy systems engineering in May 2017 and I’m really not sure what I want to do after that. I love to travel and meet new people, I love to get involved in very technical and detailed projects and I love to learn new things. I also have an exemplary academic record (but that’s boring). To emphasise how not sure I am about what I want to do after I graduate, here is a list of things that I can do/I am interested in:

Energy and power systems
Collaborate as part of a high-functioning team
Electrical transport
Data science
Programming
Project and team leadership
Working to achieve goals
Attention to detail
Maths
Smart cities

The cynic (logical thinker) in me appreciates the ridiculousness of using a grading system like above to describe such general terms (what do I even mean that I am an ‘8’ at maths?!). As such please discount the whole skills rating section above. The truth is I’m pretty much interested in everything, I love a challenge and I thrive on responsibility. If there is anything you think I would be good at (job, PhD, graduate programme, start-up, work in a bar in Spain), I would be really interested to hear about it so please get in touch.

People I've worked with

Shaun is an incredibly capable and hard working guy. While at ElectroRoute, he completed some outlandishly complex projects, going above and beyond what could be expected of him. He was a key asset and he also happens to be a really nice guy.

Shaun joined my team as an intern just before I hired 8 full time employees to build the EMEA operations center. Shaun learned fast, asked the right questions, pointed to & solved problems quickly and was in a position where he really was leading organisational change. He was in charge of numerous process and productivity improvement projects which he completed with an exceptionally high attention to detail. We have invited him back whenever he is free to work with us.

Since co-founding Gondolaa in May 2016, Shaun has shown an incredible attention to detail, the ability to filter and translate important information nodes into actionable tasks, the ability to identify and subsequently eliminate potential bottlenecks in planning and executing tasks and strategy, as well as absolutely accurate allocation of essential resources for efficient collaboration. Shaun features an integer, easy-going and admirable personality.
